data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_BuildBanner
data.value: BUILD

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ConfigFile
data.value: Configuration file that determines {ShortProductName}'s behavior (short form: /c)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Qualifiers
data.value: Qualifiers controlling what flavor to build (short form: /q)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Paths
data.value: Paths to output files or spec files which determine what gets built. This is a shorthand for a full filter expression.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CachingBanner
data.value: CACHING

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilteringBanner
data.value: FILTERING

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilteringInfo
data.value: You can choose to build only a subset of available pips by using filtering.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Tag
data.value: Filters by a tag. Case sensitive.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LoggingBanner
data.value: LOGGING

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxProc
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of processes that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time. Defaults to 25% more than the total number of processors in the current machine.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxLightProc
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of "light" processes that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time. Build specs can mark certain processes as "light" to indicate that they won't use much CPU time. Defaults to 0.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxIO
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of I/O operations that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time. The default value is 1/4 of the number of processors in the current machine, but at least 1.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_NoLogo
data.value: Suppress copyright message

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Help
data.value: Display this usage message (Short form: /?). See verbose help with /help:verbose. See DX code specific help with /help:1234.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ResponseFile
data.value: Read response file for more options

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MiscBanner
data.value: MISCELLANEOUS

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_NoWarn
data.value: Disable specific warning messages. These messages will still be logged in the main log file.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_WarnAsErrorWithList
data.value: Report specific warnings as errors.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_WarnAsError
data.value: Treat all warnings as errors.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ErrorsAndWarningsBanner
data.value: ERRORS AND WARNINGS

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_BreakOnUnexpectedFileAccess
data.value: Break into the debugger when {ShortProductName} detects that a tool accesses a file that was not declared in the specification dependencies. This option is useful when developing a new tool or SDKs using these tools. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogsDirectory
data.value: Specifies the path to the logs directory.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Color
data.value: Use colors for warnings and errors. Defaults to using colors.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogCatalog
data.value: Records the set of spec files added to the catalog. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FileVerbosity
data.value: Sets the file logging verbosity. Allowed values are 'Off', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Informational' and 'Verbose', and the single-character prefixes of those values. Defaults to Verbose. (short form: /fv)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ConsoleVerbosity
data.value: Sets the console logging verbosity. Allowed values are 'Off', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Informational' and 'Verbose', and the single-character prefixes of those values. Defaults to Informational. (short form: /cv)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayLogo_Copyright
data.value: Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayLogo_VersionInfo
data.value: {LongProductName} version 0.0.0.0

data.name: HelpText_DisplayLogo_Template
data.value: {0}. Build: {1}, Version: [{2}]

data.name: App_ConfigureFileLogging_CantCreateDirectory
data.value: The directory '{0}' could not be created, {1}.

data.name: App_ConfigureFileLogging_CantOpenLogFile
data.value: The log file '{0}' could not be opened, {1}.

data.name: Args_Args_NotRecognized
data.value: Command line argument '{0}' is not recognized.

data.name: Args_ParseVerbosity_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported logger verbosity value {0}, should be one of Off, Error, Warning, Informational, or Verbose

data.name: Args_ParseWarningList_ExpectingValidWarningNumbers
data.value: Expecting valid warning numbers for the /{0} argument but was given '{1}'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Obj
data.value: Specifies the root directory for primary build outputs (short form: /o)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Property
data.value: Specifies a property that overrides an allowed environment variable (short form: /p)

data.name: Args_Args_NoConfigGiven
data.value: No configuration file specified with the /config: argument (short form: /c).

data.name: Args_FileAccessAsErrors_FailPipFlags
data.value: Flags /unsafe_UnexpectedFileAccessesAreErrors- and /failPipOnFileAccessError- are incompatible. Please specify only one.

data.name: App_Main_BuildFailed
data.value: Build FAILED

data.name: App_Main_BuildSucceeded
data.value: Build Succeeded

data.name: App_Main_Logs
data.value: Logs

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheDirectory
data.value: Specifies the root directory for the incremental artifact cache (short form: /cd)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Incremental
data.value: When enabled, artifacts are built incrementally based on which source files have changed. Defaults to on.

data.name: Args_ScriptFile_Deprecated
data.value: Error: /scriptfile: and /s: have been deprecated so instead of using /s:{0} you can use /filter:spec=’{0}’ or just {0} without the /s: prefix.

data.name: App_Main_Log
data.value: Log: {0}

data.name: App_Main_ValuesLog
data.value: Values Log: {0}

data.name: App_Main_Snapshot
data.value: Snapshot: {0}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogObservedAccesses
data.value: Records the files observed to be accessed by individual pips to the log. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogFileEnforcementTables
data.value: Records the file enforcement access tables for individual pips to the log. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UnexpectedFileAccessesAreErrors
data.value: When enabled, if {ShortProductName} detects that a tool accesses a file that was not declared in the specification dependencies, it is treated as an error instead of a warning. Turning this option off results in an unsafe configuration (for diagnostic purposes only). Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreZwRenameFileInformation
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not detour the ZwRenameFileInformation API. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreZwOtherFileInformation
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not detour the ZwLinkFileInformation, ZwFileNameFileInformation, ZwDispositionFileInformation, ZwModeFileInformation APIs. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced. Defaults to off - the functions are detoured.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreNonCreateFileReparsePoints
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not follow symlinks for access validation and reporting for API's outisde of CreateFile, NtCreate, and OpenFile. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreSetFileInformationByHandle
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not detour the SetFileInformationByHandle API. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreReparsePoints
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not track reparse points. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced. Any reparse points (symlinks and mount points) will not be followed.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnorePreloadedDlls
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not report Dlls loaded before Detours was started. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced.

data.name: Args_SandboxKind_WrongPlatform
data.value: Sandbox kind '{0}' cannot be used on '{1}' operating system

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SandboxKind
data.value: Specifies the sandbox kind. Allowed values are 'None' (no sandboxing), 'Default' (default sandboxing), 'WinDetours', 'MacOsKext'. Default is 'Default'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DisableDetours
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not detour any processes. This might lead to incorrect builds because any file accesses will not be enforced.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreNonExistentProbes
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not report non existent probes, that are not in sealed directories. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced and validated. Certain calls to GetFileAttribute method for non existing files will not be reported to {ShortProductName}.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ExistingDirectoryProbesAsEnumerations
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will report existing directory probes as enumerations. This might lead to cases where pips will be executed even when there is no need for it.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreNtCreateFile
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not intercept NtCreateFile calls. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreZwCreateOpenQueryFamily
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not intercept ZwCreateFile, ZwOpenFile, and ZwQueryDirectoryFile calls. This might lead to incorrect builds because some file accesses will not be enforced. This flag is off by default.

data.name: App_Main_Cache
data.value: Cache

data.name: App_Main_Objects
data.value: Objects

data.name: App_Main_Out
data.value: Out

data.name: Args_Phase_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported value for phase {0}, should be either None, Parse, Evaluate, ScheduleExecute

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Phase
data.value: Specifies the phase until which {ShortProductName} runs. Allowed values are None (no phase is run), Parse (run until parsing is done), Evaluate (run until value evaluation is done), Schedule (run until scheduling is done), Execute (run until execution is done). Default is Execute.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Channel
data.value: Identifies a communication channel. If not specified, the default channel name is derived from the main configuration file. Use together with /listen.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Server
data.value: Launches or connects to a {ShortProductName} app-server (builds may occur in a re-usable background process, with reduced startup time). Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ExecutionControlBanner
data.value: ENGINE CONTROL

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LowPriority
data.value: Runs the build engine and all tools at a lower priority in order to provide better responsiveness to interactive processes on the current machine.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_StopOnFirstError
data.value: Stops the build engine the first time an error is generated by either {ShortProductName} or one of the tool it runs. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PipTimeout
data.value: How long to wait before terminating individual processes, in milliseconds. Setting this value will only have an effect if no other timeout is specified for a process.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PipWarningTimeout
data.value: After how much time to issue a warning that an individual process runs too long, in milliseconds. Setting this value will only have an effect if no other timeout is specified for a process.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DiagBanner
data.value: DIAGNOSTICS

data.name: App_HandleUnhandledFailure_UnknownException
data.value: Unknown exception

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ViewerOptions
data.value: Controls viewer behavior. Allowed values are Show, Hide, and Disable. Defaults to Hide.

data.name: Args_Error_ViewModeUnrecognized
data.value: Unsupported viewer mode value {0}, should be one of Show, Hide, or Disable.

data.name: Program_ConfigureFileLogging_Can_t_get_directory_name
data.value: Can't get directory name

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DebugIgnoreChangeJournal
data.value: If disabled, {ShortProductName} will not use the NTFS / ReFS change journal for caching or incremental builds. This is an unsafe configuration (for diagnostic purposes only). Defaults to on.

data.name: Args_Diagnostic_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported value for /diagnostic. Specify a functional area: Scheduler, Parser, Storage, Transformers, Engine, Viewer, PipExecutor, PipInputAssertions, ChangeJournalService, HostApplication, CommonInfrastructure, CacheInteraction, or HybridInterop.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Diagnostic
data.value: Enables diagnostic logging for a functional area. This option may be specified multiple times. Areas: Scheduler, Parser, Storage, Transformers, Engine, Viewer, PipExecutor, PipInputAssertions, ChangeJournalService, HostApplication, CommonInfrastructure, CacheInteraction, HybridInterop. (short form: /diag)

data.name: App_ViewMode_Hold
data.value: Viewer connected. Holding process until the viewer exits.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PipTimeoutMultiplier
data.value: Multiplier applied to the final timeout for individual processes. Setting a multiplier greater than one will increase the timeout accordingly for all pips, even those with an explicit non-default timeout set.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PipWarningTimeoutMultiplier
data.value: Multiplier applied to the warning timeout for individual processes. Setting a multiplier greater than one will increase the warning timeout accordingly for all pips, even those with an explicit non-default warning timeout set.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxRelativeOutputDirectoryLength
data.value: Directories under the object directory root will get shortened to avoid too long path names. Defaults to 64 characters for relative output directories.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_BuildLockPolling
data.value: Number of seconds to wait for an executing build to finish before polling again for completion. Defaults to 15 sec.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_BuildWaitTimeout
data.value: Number minutes to wait for an executing build to finish before failing the current one. Defaults to 0 minute.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EnableLazyOutputs
data.value: Enables lazy materialization (deployment) of pips' outputs from local cache. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptShowSlowest
data.value: Indicates whether {ShortProductName} should log information about the slowest {ShortScriptName} elements by phase. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptShowLargest
data.value: Indicates whether {ShortProductName} should log information about the largest {ShortScriptName} files. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DependencySelection
data.value: Specifies additional pips to run based on dependency information of pips matched in filter. May be: empty (all dependencies) or "+" (dependencies and dependents).

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter
data.value: Specifies a filter expression (short form: /f). See verbose help (/help:verbose) for details about constructing filter expressions.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilterExampleDirectory
data.value: Selects all pips originating from spec files within \src\utilities and all subdirectories, including, their dependencies and dependents.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilterExampleNoTest
data.value: Selects all pips not marked with the 'test' tag, including their dependencies

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Examples
data.value: Filtering examples:

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_ExamplesBinaryFilter
data.value: Selects all pips marked with tag 'csc.exe' and not marked with tag 'test'. Runs them and their dependencies

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Expression
data.value: Expression form <negation><filterType>='<filterArgument>'or <negation>(<filter><binaryOperator><filter>) or <function>(<filter>) where <negation> is the "~" character to negate the expression, <binaryOperator> is either "and" or "or", and <function> is "dpt" or "dpc"

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilterTypeExplanation
data.value: Types of filters:

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Spec
data.value: Filters by the spec that caused a pip to be included in the graph. Similar to filtering on the union of all values defined in that spec.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Spec_ValueTransitive
data.value: Similar to the basic spec filter, but transitively follows all value (and sealed directory) dependencies.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Id
data.value: Filters by a pip's id as shown in the viewer.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Transformer
data.value: Filters by a transformer name. Case sensitive.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ExportGraph
data.value: Specifies the optional file path to export a JSON-formatted graph of pips.

data.name: App_Visualizer_DevModeMessage1
data.value: Visualizer is in devmode for location: '{0}'.

data.name: App_Visualizer_DevModeMessage2
data.value: Press Ctrl+C to terminate {ShortProductName}

data.name: App_AppDomain_UnhandledException
data.value: Unhandled exception happened during execution

data.name: Args_Experimental_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported experimental flag {0}. See /? for supported values.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Experimental__0
data.value: Enables an experimental feature (short form: /exp). Available experimental features: {0}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheGraph
data.value: Caches the build graph between runs, avoiding the parse and evaluation phases when no graph inputs have changed. Defaults to on.

data.name: Args_Environment_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported value for environment '{0}'. Supported values are '{1}'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Environment
data.value: Environment build is running in. Allowed values '{0}'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_RemoteTelemetry
data.value: When enabled, sends telemetry information for remote collection. Defaults to off.

data.name: Args_ArtificialCacheMiss_AlreadyProvided
data.value: The '/injectCacheMisses' option may only be provided once.

data.name: Args_ArtificialCacheMiss_Invalid
data.value: Invalid miss-rate options: '{0}'. See the description for /injectCacheMisses. Example: ~0.1#123 (inverted rate of 10%; seed 123)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_InjectCacheMisses
data.value: Sets a rate for artificial cache misses (pips may be re-run with this likelihood, when otherwise not necessary). Miss rate and options are specified as "[~]Rate[#Seed]". The '~' symbol negates the rate (it becomes an allowed hit rate). The 'Rate' must be a numeric value in the range [0.0, 1.0]. The optional 'Seed' is an integer value fully determining the random aspect of the miss rate (the same seed and miss rate will always pick the same set of pips).

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CustomLog
data.value: Sets a custom log file for a specific set of event IDs. Event list should be comma separated integers excluding the DX prefix.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_NoLog
data.value: Removes a set of event IDs from the standard log. Does not apply to warning, error, critical, and always level events.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_NoExecutionLog
data.value: Removes a set of event IDs from the execution log (.xlg).

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CleanTempDirectories
data.value: Cleans per pip temp directories after the pip successfully exits to save disk space. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributedBuildBanner
data.value: DISTRIBUTED BUILD

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributedBuildWorker
data.value: Specifies the IP address or host name and TCP port of remote worker build services which this process can dispatch work to during a distributed build (can specify multiple). (short form: /dbw)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributedBuildServicePort
data.value: Specifies the TCP port of a locally running distributed build service (master or worker) which peers can connect to during a distributed build. This argument is required for executing a distributed build. (short form: /dbsp)

data.name: Args_DistributedBuildRole_UnsupportedValue
data.value: Unsupported value for distributed build role {0}, should be [N]one, [M]aster, or [W]orker.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributedBuildRole
data.value: Specifies the role the node plays in the distributed build: [N]one, [M]aster, or [W]orker. This argument is required for executing a distributed build. (short form: /dbr)

data.name: Args_DistributedBuildWorker_InvalidServiceLocation
data.value: Invalid distributed build worker location '{0}'. Ensure location is of the form <IP address or host name>:<port>. <IP address or host name>should be a non-empty string and <port>must be a valid port number.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TempDirectory
data.value: Specifies the root directory for per-pip temp directories. When unspecified, temp directories will be created under the per-pip object directories.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Output
data.value: Filters pips by the output files they create.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_PathArgument
data.value: The value may be: 'path' to match a file, 'path\'. to match files within a directory, 'path\*' to match files in a directory and recursive directories, 'Mount[MountName]' to match files under a mount, or '*\fileName' to match files with a specific name no matter where they are. 'path' may be an absolute or relative path. 'fileName' must be a fileName and may not contain any directory separator characters.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheConfigFilePath
data.value: Path to cache config file.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EnableDedupChunk
data.value: When enabled, DedupChunk hashing algorithm is used instead of VSO0. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogStats
data.value: Logs key/value statistics to default stats file in the same folder as the main log file. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogStatus
data.value: Logs build status information to a CSV file in the same folder as the main log file. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogOutput
data.value: Specifies how process standard error and standard output should be reported. Allowed values are 'TruncatedOutputOnError', 'FullOutputAlways', 'FullOutputOnError', 'FullOutputOnWarningOrError'. Default is 'TruncatedOutputOnError'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TraceInfo
data.value: Attaches tracing information to the build. May be specified multiple times. Ex: /TraceInfo:Branch=MyBranch

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogCounters
data.value: Collects various performance counters and logs phase specific aggregations. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_RootMap
data.value: Specifies a drive mapping applied during this build. Paths under specified letters will be mapped to the corresponding paths at the system level for the build process and the tools launched as a part of the build. (short form: /rm)

data.name: App_RootMapping_CantCreateDirectory
data.value: Directory ({0}) for root mapping drive '{1}' does not exist and unable to create directory for mapping, {2}.

data.name: App_RootMapping_CantApplyRootMappings
data.value: Unable to apply root mappings.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AllowMissingOutputs
data.value: When specified, suppresses errors for specified-but-not-produced outputs with the given name. May be specified more than once. Using this option results in an unsafe configuration (for diagnostic purposes only). Defaults to false.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TranslateDirectory
data.value: Specify translation of directories before access policy is applied - the fromPath is replaced with toPath in the names of paths accessed. Make sure to add the trailing path separators. Valid from/to path separators are '<' and ' and '::'. Recommended separator is '::'. Defaults to no directory translation is done.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Value
data.value: Filters by value name. Case sensitive.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_ValueTransitive
data.value: Similar to the basic value filter, but transitively follows all value (and sealed directory) dependencies. Case sensitive.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheSpecs
data.value: Caches build specification files to a single large file to improve read performance on spinning disks. When unset the behavior is dynamic based on whether root configuration file is on a drive that is detected to have a seek penalty. May be forced on or off using the flag.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheMemoryUsage
data.value: How to balance memory usage vs. fetching values on demand from disk, which carries a seek penalty on spinning disks. Allowed values are 'Auto', 'Minimize', 'Liberal'. The default automatic mode checks if the relevant drive has a seek penalty. A particular behavior may be forced using the flag.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DeterminismProbeUsage
data.value: When enabled, cache hits are ignored, but all pips are built and attempted to be added to the cache, with cache collisions reported to identify non-deterministic tools. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogProcesses
data.value: Records all launched processes, including nested processes, of each pip to the log. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogProcessData
data.value: When enabled, records process execution times and IO counts and transfers. Requires /LogProcesses to be enabled. Defaults to off.

data.name: EventSummaryHeader
data.value: EventId,Count

data.name: AppServer_TerminatingServer_PipeDisconnect
data.value: Terminating Dom{ShortProductName}ino server process because communication with the client has been lost.

data.name: AppServer_TerminatingClient_PipeDisconnect
data.value: Terminating {ShortProductName} client process because communication with the server has been lost: {0}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Snapshot
data.value: When enabled, captures build inputs needed for evaluation or the full build depending on the specified snapshot mode (see /snapshotMode)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SnapshotMode
data.value: Specifies the mode used to snapshot the build: None, Full (capture all build inputs in VHD file), Evaluation (captures build specifications in zip file). Defaults to Evaluation.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Scrub
data.value: Before executing, scrubs (deletes) files not marked as inputs or outputs of the current build. Only applies to mounts marked as Scrubbable. This includes the object directory but none others by default. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CleanOnly
data.value: Deletes output files that would have been produced by the build. Pips will not be executed.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseHardlinks
data.value: When enabled, hardlinks will be used (when possible) to de-duplicate content in output directories with content in the build cache. This reduces space usage and improves performance, since copies are avoided. Creating hardlinks requires that the output directories and cache are on the same volume, and that volume must use NTFS. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AnalyzeDependencyViolations
data.value: When enabled, file monitoring violations will be analyzed to emit additional warnings about high-level dependency problems (examples include double-writes and read-write races). Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxIOMultiplier
data.value: Specifies maxIO in terms of a multiplier of the machine's processor count. Defaults to 0.25.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxProcMultiplier
data.value: Specifies maxProc in terms of a multiplier of the machine's processor count. Defaults to 1.25.

data.name: Args_Error_InvalidGraphId
data.value: Invalid graph identifier '{0}' specified. Graph identifier must be a 40 digit hex string (no delimiters). Example: ad2d42d2ec5d2ca0c0b7ad65402d07c7ef40b91e

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LoadGraph
data.value: Loads a cached build graph stored under the given fingerprint (40 digit hex string, no delimiters), path to cached graph directory, or canonical name.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EngineCacheDirectory
data.value: Allows overriding where engine state will be cached. If unset, it will be stored in a subdirectory of the artifact cache.

data.name: HelpText_DiplayHelp_RelatedActivityId
data.value: An external related ETW activity identifier. The top level {ShortProductName} activity will be logged as a child of this one.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_Input
data.value: Filters by an input to a pip.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogExecution
data.value: Logs an execution trace to the default trace file in the same folder as the main log file. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ServerDeploymentDir
data.value: Sets the directory where the server process deployment will be created. It not specified, the deployment will be created in the directory {MainExecutableName} is running from.

data.name: DurationMs
data.value: DurationMs

data.name: TelemetryInitialization
data.value: TelemetryInitialization

data.name: App_BugInConfiguration
data.value: An automated validation failed when constructing the internal configuration object. Validations should not be enabled on this object. Please report this bug. Failed validation site was: {0}

data.name: Server_FailedToStart
data.value: Server failed to start

data.name: Server_StartupTimeoutReached
data.value: Server process did not start within allowed timeout

data.name: Args_NoExecutionLogOnWorker
data.value: Execution log is not allowed on workers

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogPrefix
data.value: The prefix to add to all log file names (default: {ShortProductName})

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogsToRetain
data.value: The number of previous logs to retain.

data.name: Args_LogPrefix_Invalid
data.value: '{0}' is an invalid value for 'logPrefix'

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptBanner
data.value: {ShortScriptName}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptDebugScript
data.value: Whether to launch {ShortScriptName} debugger on start. Intended to be used by IDEs only (if you pass this option when running form command line, {ShortScriptName} evaluator will just wait forever). Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptDebugScriptBreakOnExit
data.value: Whether to break at the end of the evaluation phase. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptDebugScriptPort
data.value: TCP/IP port for the {ShortScriptName} debugger to listen on. Defaults to 41177.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScriptTypeCheck
data.value: Type checks specifications. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxFrontEndConcurrency
data.value: Specifies the maximum concurrency level for constructing the pip graph in the FrontEnd. The default value is 25% more than the total number of processors in the current machine. (short form: /mf)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EmitSpotlightIndexingWarning
data.value: Controls if the engine should emit a warning that indicates that artifact folders are indexed by Spotlight. This flag is on by default.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DisableConHostSharing
data.value: Disables sharing of the ConHost process between PIPs. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScanChangeJournal
data.value: Scans volume change journals to determine spec file changes for graph reuse check. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheSessionName
data.value: If specified, this is the new unique cache session name for this build. If not given, the build cache session will not be tracked.

data.name: ConsoleListener_EvalStatusLine
data.value: Values: {{0,{0}}} done, {{1,{0}}} waiting

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UsePartialEvaluation
data.value: When enabled, a partial graph may be constructed to decrease evaluation time. Defaults to off for XML specs.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ShowingStandardHelp
data.value: Standard help shown. For complete help options, use /help:verbose

data.name: App_Vs_SolutionFile
data.value: VS Solution File: {0}

data.name: App_LogsDirectory
data.value: Log Directory: {0}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SubstSource
data.value: Path of the original root that has been substituted to another. Log messages will be converted back to this path root. Must be specified with /substTarget.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SubstTarget
data.value: Path of the subst target. Messages rooted at this path will be converted to the root configured in SubstSource. Must be specified with /substSource

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FileSystemMode
data.value: Specifies the type of filesystem rules to use when the sandbox computes input assertions. Allowed values are: 'RealAndMinimalPipGraph' ({ShortScriptName} default) - uses the real filesystem for read only mounts and a minimal pip graph based view for writeable mounts, 'RealAndPipGraph' (XML default) - same as RealAndMinimalPipGraph except a full pip graph is used, 'AlwaysMinimalGraph' - always uses the pip graph.

data.name: App_Vs_InstallPlugin
data.value: {0} does not have the latest {ShortProductName} plugin installed. Before opening VS, please install the latest version ({1}) per the {ShortProductName} wiki

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ForceSkipDependencies
data.value: Specifies that dependencies of processes requested in the filter should be skipped as long as all the inputs are present.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PreserveOutputs
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will preserve the existing state of Process pip output files instead of deleting them before starting the process. This may lead to incorrect builds depending on how the process behaves when prior outputs are present. Specify "/unsafe_preserveOutputs:Reset" to reset the salt added to cached processes run with preserved outputs.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_NormalizeReadTimestamps
data.value: When enabled, all file reads seen by processes will have normalized timestamps across builds. When disabled, the actual timestamps will be allowed to flow through to processes, so long as they are newer than the static timestamp used to enforce rewrite ordering (2002). Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseLargeNtClosePreallocatedList
data.value: When enabled, it uses a larger initial preallocated list for draining NtClose events. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseExtraThreadToDrainNtClose
data.value: When enabled, the draining of the {ShortProductName} handle cache happens on a different thread than the one that called the NtClose. Handles to be cleaned are collected in a thread safe, non-locking list and removed from the cache usinga different thread. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ReuseEngineState
data.value: Reuse engine state between client sessions if /server and /cacheGraph are enabled. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FlushPageCacheToFileSystemOnStoringOutputsToCache
data.value: Flush page cache to file system on storing outputs to cache. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TreatDirectoryAsAbsentFileOnHashingInputContent
data.value: Treats directory as absent file on hashing the content of input

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DisableCycleDetection
data.value: Disables cycle detection during evaluation. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EnforceFileAccesses
data.value: Whether {ShortProductName} is to monitor file accesses of individual tools at all. Disabling monitoring results in an unsafe configuration (for diagnostic purposes only). Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DiplayHelp_VS
data.value: Generates a VS solution file and MSBuild files for C# and C++ projects. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SolutionName
data.value: Specifies the name of the solution which will be generated via /vs.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_VsOutputSrc
data.value: MSBuild project files are written under the source tree. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_SpecDependencies
data.value: Similar to the basic spec filter, but transitively includes specs of pips referenced by pips in target spec(s) of the filter.

data.name: ConsoleListener_PipsResourceWaitingStatusLine
data.value: {0} running pips waiting on resources

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxRamUtilizationPercentage
data.value: Specifies the maximum machine wide RAM utilization allowed before the scheduler will stop scheduling more work to allow resources to be freed. Defaults to 85%.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MinAvailableRam
data.value: Specifies the minimum available machine wide RAM (in megabytes) allowed before the scheduler will stop scheduling more work to allow resources to be freed. Default is 500 mb.

data.name: App_ServerKilled
data.value: Killing associated server mode process. No build will be performed.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FilterFunctionExplanation
data.value: Filter Functions:

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_DependenciesFunction
data.value: Include outputs of transitive closure of inner filter dependencies in the filter (e.g. 'dpc(tag='check')' to include all dependencies of pips tagged with the check tag)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_DependentsFunction
data.value: Include outputs of transitive closure of inner filter dependents in the filter (e.g. 'dpt(tag='test')' to include all dependents of pips tagged with the test tag)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxCacheLookup
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of cache lookups that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time. The default value is three times the number of processors in the current machine.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxChooseWorker
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of choose worker operations that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time for distributed builds. The default value is 1/4 of the number of processors in the current machine, but at least 1.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxMaterialize
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of materialize operations that {ShortProductName} will launch at one time. Defaults to twice the number of processors in the current machine.

data.name: DX_Help_Link
data.value: http://aka.ms/dhelp

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaskUntrackedAccesses
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} does not consider any access under untracked paths or scopes for sake of cache lookup. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FancyConsole
data.value: When enabled, the console will give frequent updates of the status of processes that are running. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FancyConsoleMaxStatusPips
data.value: Maximum number of concurrently executing pips to render in Fancy Console view. Defaults to 5.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AllowCopySymlink
data.value: When enabled, allow copying symlink. Defaults to true.

data.name: Args_Malformed_RelatedActivityGuid
data.value: The specified related activity guid is not a well-formed GUID

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ProfileReportDestination
data.value: Destination file of the profiling report. Default is '{0}' and it is generated in the current directory. Only considered if /profileScript is specified.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TrackBuildsInUserFolder
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will log every build invocation in the users folder so the viewer and analyzers can use that to figure out what to use. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TrackMethodInvocations
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} captures most frequently invoked {ShortScriptName} methods. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ProfileScript
data.value: Runs a profiler for {ShortScriptName} evaluation, generating a TSV file with profiling information.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributedBuildWorkerSourceMaterialization
data.value: Enables materialization of source files on distributed workers. NOTE: Source files are required to be present in the worker's remote or local cache.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ValidateDistribution
data.value: Performs validations to ensure the build can be distributed. Defaults to on for distributed builds, disabled in single machine builds.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ReuseOutputsOnDisk
data.value: Reuse outputs on disk for checking up-to-dateness during cache look-up and for file materialization

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MaxTypeCheckingConcurrency
data.value: Specifies the maximum concurrency level type checking phase. Defaults to /maxFrontEndConcurrency - 25% more than the total number of processors in the current machine.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreGetFinalPathNameByHandle
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not intercept GetFinalPathNameByHandle calls. This may lead to failures when using subst because non-subst paths will be used. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogProcessDetouringStatus
data.value: When enabled, store the Detouring Status messages in the Execution log. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_HardExitOnErrorInDetours
data.value: When enabled, detours will exit the process on Detours error with a special exit code. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CheckDetoursMessageCount
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will check the count of messages sent to {ShortProductName} from the pip process tree and will fail the pip (build) if there is mismatch. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AllowInternalDetoursErrorNotificationFile
data.value: When enabled, the detoured processes will store internal errors in a special file. If this file contains data at the end of pip execution, the pip (build) will fail. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_KextNumberOfKextConnections
data.value: [macOS] Specifies the number of connections that drain the sandbox kernel extension file access reports on macOS systems - the sandbox kernel extension allocates one report queue per connection to balance the system load when reporting file accesses.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_KextReportQueueSizeMb
data.value: [macOS] Specifies the size in MB of a sandbox kernel extension report queue. Use this cautiously, because it allocates the specified size in wired system memory multiplied by the number of kernel extension connections.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_KextThrottleCpuUsageBlockThresholdPercent
data.value: [macOS] Causes throttling to be triggered whenever CPU usage is above this value.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_KextThrottleCpuUsageWakeupThresholdPercent
data.value: [macOS] A blocked process can be awakened only when CPU usage drops below this value (defaults to /KextThrottleCpuUsageBlockThresholdPercent).

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_KextThrottleMinAvailableRamMB
data.value: [macOS] Causes throttling to be triggered whenever available RAM drops below this value. (takes precedence over CPU usage thresholds)

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogMemory
data.value: Collects actual memory usage when collection performance counters. This has a negaitve performance impact and should only be used when analyzing memory consumption. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_StoreFingerprints
data.value: Stores fingerprint computation information for each pip seen in the build in a peristent key-value store that can be accessed from the logs.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScanChangeJournalTimeLimitInSec
data.value: Time limit in second for scanning volume change journal. Set to -1 for no limit. Defaults to 30 seconds.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IncrementalScheduling
data.value: When enabled, scheduling is performed incrementally. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ScrubDirectory
data.value: Before executing, scrubs (deletes) files and directories not marked as inputs or outputs of the current build in the specified directory. Only applies to directories under mounts marked as Scrubbable.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_VerifyCacheLookupPin
data.value: Verifies pins for cache lookup output content by attempting to materialize the content. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DistributeCacheLookups
data.value: Perform cache look-ups on workers in the distributed build. Default to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CanonicalizeFilterOutputs
data.value: Canonicalize filter for output filtering. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ServerMaxIdleTimeInMinutes
data.value: Maximum idle time in minutes for server mode. Defaults to 60 minutes.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AllowFetchingCachedGraphFromContentCache
data.value: Allow fetching cached graph from content cache. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_SymlinkDefinitionFile
data.value: Specifies the file containing mappings from symlinks to their targets, and those symlinks will be created, if necessary, before pip executions

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LazySymlinkCreation
data.value: Creates symlink from the symlink definition file lazily. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CompressGraphFiles
data.value: When enabled, graph files are compressed.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ProcessRetries
data.value: Number of retries for process execution if the process exits with exit codes that allow for retries. Defaults to 0.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_ReplayWarnings
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will replay warning messages from pips that were cache hits. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EnableIncrementalFrontEnd
data.value: Enables incremental spec analysis based on number of changed specs. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseFileContentTablePathMappings
data.value: Use file content table path mappings to avoid opening handles for hashing files already in the table. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PopulateSymlinkDirectory
data.value: Specifies a directory to eagerly populate with symlinks when symlink definition file and lazy symlink creation are enabled.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UnexpectedSymlinkAccessReportingMode
data.value: Specifies the when unexpected symlink file/directory accesses are reported as warnings: None, ExecutionOnly (only for executed processes), All (executed and cached process observations report unexpected accesses). Default: All. NOTE: This is only enabled when a symlink definition file is provided.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_DisableGraphPostValidation
data.value: Disables post validation of graph construction. Defaults to on.

data.name: DX_Help_Link_Prefix
data.value: For help with {ShortProductName} warnings or errors, see:

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_StoreOutputsToCache
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} stores pip outputs to the cache. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PinCachedOutputs
data.value: Indicates whether outputs should be pinned in CAS for cached pips. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_VfsCasRoot
data.value: Specifies the root of the virtualized CAS directory. This should be the same as the root passed to bvfs.exe.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FileChangeTrackingExclusionRoot
data.value: Specifies one or more roots to be excluded from file change tracking. NOTE: This flag is not compatible with /incrementalScheduling which requires all paths to be tracked.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FileChangeTrackingInclusionRoot
data.value: Specifies one or more roots to be included in file change tracking. NOTE: When specified all paths not under inclusion roots are excluded from file change tracking. This flag is not compatible with /incrementalScheduling which requires all paths to be tracked.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_FileChangeTrackerInitializationMode
data.value: Modes for initializing file change tracker. Allowed values are ResumeExisting, ForceRestart. Defaults to ResumeExisting.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_InferNonExistenceBasedOnParentPathInRealFileSystem
data.value: Infers the non-existence of a path based on the parent path when checking the real file system in file system view. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_OutputMaterializationExclusionRoot
data.value: Specifies one or more roots to be excluded from output materialization. NOTE: Files needed for execution are always materialized even if under this root.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseCustomPipDescriptionOnConsole
data.value: Indicates whether pip descriptions should be shortened to (semi-stable hash, customer-supplied pip description) when reporting errors and warnings on the console. Defaults to on.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_EnforceAccessPoliciesOnDirectoryCreation
data.value: Indicates whether {ShortProductName} should enforce access policies on CreateDirectory for paths under writable mounts as well as the cases when the directory already exists. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_CopyDependentsFunction
data.value: Include outputs of filter along with all downstream copies of the outputs via copy pips.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_Filter_RequiredInputsFunction
data.value: Include the immediate inputs (outputs of direct dependencies) for the pips specified filter.

data.name: App_Errors_LogsDirectory
data.value: {0} ERROR(S). Log Directory: {1}

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_CacheMiss
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} performs the on-the-fly cache miss analysis during the execute phase. If no value is given (/cacheMiss+), the local FingerprintStore is used for comparison. The user can pass the list of changesets if they want to compare the build to a remote FingerprintStore: /cacheMiss:[<sha>:<sha>:...]. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LogPipStaticFingerprintTexts
data.value: Log pip static fingerprint texts. Defaults to off.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_TelemetryTagPrefix
data.value: Prefix of tag considered for sending aggregate statistics to telemetry

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MsBuildBanner
data.value: MSBuild

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MsBuild_LogVerbosity
data.value: Activates MSBuild file logging for each MSBuild project file to 'msbuild.log' in the log directory, using the specified MSBuild log verbosity. WARNING: This option adds I/O overhead to your build, since MSBuild console logging is already enabled and captured, and use of Detailed or Diagnostic levels should only be used temporarily to avoid significantly increased build times.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MsBuild_EnableBinLogTracing
data.value: Controls whether MSBuild binlog tracing should be enabled for the build. The binlog is placed in the logs directory for each MSBuild project as 'msbuild.binlog'. WARNING: This option increases build I/O and should only be used temporarily to avoid increased build times.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MsBuild_EnableEngineTracing
data.value: Controls whether MSBuild engine/scheduler tracing should be enabled for the build. WARNING: Use this option only temporarily as it will significantly increase build times.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MasterCpuMultiplier
data.value: Specifies the cpu queue limit in terms of a multiplier of the normal limit when at least one remote worker gets connected. Defaults to 0.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_LaunchDebugger
data.value: Launches the debugger during boot (in the server process if applicable).

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_MasterCacheLookupMultiplier
data.value: Specifies the cachelookup queue limit in terms of a multiplier of the normal limit when at least one remote worker gets connected. Defaults to 0.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_IgnoreDynamicWritesOnAbsentProbes
data.value: When enabled, {ShortProductName} will not flag as violations absent path probes that coexist with writes under output directories for those same paths.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_StoreFingerprintsWithMode
data.value: Stores fingerprint computation information for each pip seen in the build in a peristent key-value store that can be accessed from the logs. "Default" mode will check for pre-existing entries before overwriting entries. "ExecutionFingerprintsOnly" mode will only store fingerprints computed when a pip executes. On strong fingerprint cache misses, setting this will SKIP storing fingerprints computed at cache lookup time, which are useful for analyzing strong fingerprint misses. "IgnoreExistingEntries" mode will overwrite entries without doing any (random) reads, this is only recommended on spin drives experiencing slowdowns.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_UseFileContentTable
data.value: When enabled, use file content table. Defaults to on on Windows, but off on Unix

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_PosixDeleteMode
data.value: Controls the applicability of file/directory deletion using POSIX delete. Allowed values are NoRun, RunFirst, and RunLast. Defaults for Windows is RunLast, and for Unix is RunFirst

data.name: Args_ProfileRedirectEnabled_NoPathProvided
data.value: User profile redirect was enabled (/enableProfileRedirect+) but the path to the redirected user profile was not set. Please use /RedirectedUserProfileJunctionRoot:<path> to set the path under which a junction to the real user profile will be created.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_RunInContainerAndAllowDoubleWrites
data.value: Configures the default for all scheduled pips to run in a container with output isolation, allowing double writes to occur. Individual pips can override this setting. This is an unsafe option.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AdminRequiredProcessExecutionMode
data.value: Mode for running processes that required admin privilege. Allowed values are 'Internal' (BuildXL starts the process as an immediate child process), 'ExternalTool' (BuildXL starts a sandboxed process executor tool as a child process, and in turn the tool starts the admin-required process as its child process), 'ExternalVM' (BuildXL sends command to VM to execute a sandboxed process executor tool in VM, and in turn the tool starts the admin-required process as its child process) . For Internal and ExternalTool, the process will be run with the same elevation level as BuildXL. For ExternalVM, the process will be run with the elevation level in the VM. Defaults to 'Internal'.

data.name: HelpText_DisplayHelp_AdditionalConfigFile
data.value: Additional configuration files that can contain module definitions (short form: /ac)

data.name: Args_AdminRequiredProcessExecutionMode_NotSupportedOnNonWindows
data.value: Admin-required process execution mode '{0}' is not supported on non-Windows OS
